fields.description:
h3. Summary

When user add a comment and try to add an image using the CTRL + V or drag-drop screenshot, JIRA will automatically add the image but the comment will be lost

Steps to reproduce:

# Open an issue page (best reproduced in Google Chrome).
# Add a comment like *Test*.
# Copy an image to the comment field.

(i) Issue only reproducible in Text Mode.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.4.X
Google Chrome


h3. Expected Results

JIRA attach the image and add the comment.


h3. Actual Results

JIRA attach the image and the comment is lost.


h3.Workaround

# Use the "Visual" mode in comment section.
# Attach image using the "More" -> "Attach file" and then add a comment.
fields.summary: Comment lost after using CTRL + V shortcut or drag-drop

fields.description:
h5. *Issue Summary*

Currently, when a user is performing a project import from one JIRA instance to another so they can merge the instances, the first place which they stop by is [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/restoring-a-project-from-backup-802592982.html].

However, there are lots of known bugs and various feature requests that are already raised in https://jira.atlassian.com in which if added to the page would keep users up to date on possible shortcomings or bugs that have been reported so they can consult these before they begin the project import process.

For example:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30460
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34362

To name a few.

h5. *Existing Behavior*

At the moment, there are no links to known problems with project import in the documentation and users would either have to run into these issues in the middle of migration to realize a problem exists or comb this site judiciously to find known bugs with the project import.
fields.summary: Improve Project Import Documentation

fields.description:
h3. Description
After added the JIRA issue collector in confluence, the button will not disappear when the user scrolls a confluence page. The button only disappears when the user scrolling on the confluence dashboard. The customer would like to hide the button when the user scrolled the page.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a jira issue macro in JIRA
# Copy the script and add it to confluence custom html (At beginning of the BODY section)
# Go to Confluence dashboard and scroll down. You will notice the issue collector button will disappear when the user scrolls down.
# Go to a confluence page and scroll down. The issue collector will not hide and stay at the top.
(i) For better understanding, please review the following video.
 [^Recording #21.mp4] 

*Expected Result*
The issue collector button is hidden when user scroll down the page

*Actual Result*
The issue collector button does not hide when the user scrolls down the page.
fields.summary: JIRA issue collector does not hide when scrolling
Ability to rename a user

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After clicking on a file:/// link in IE to open a local file in explorer, the JIRA menus for Dashboard, Projects, and Issues will no populate until a reload of the page.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Server 7.3.6, 7.4.1
* IE 11.0.46

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with a valid file:/// link in the description (such as file:////localhost)
# Ensure that the base URL for your JIRA instance is added to the intranet or trusted security zones in IE's Security configuration
# While viewing the issue, click the file link
# Go back to the IE window and attempt to use the menu's at the top of the screen

h3. Expected Results
Menus populate without issue

h3. Actual Results
The menus are not populated (except for boards on software projects)

 [^jraserver-65985-screencast.mov]  

h3. Notes
Looking at the IE console when this occurs, there are no Javascript errors and clicking the menu items does not trigger a REST call across the network as it does when everything is working.

h3.Workaround
Reloading the page resolves the immediate issue and the navigation works again afterward.  Click on the menus before clicking a file link appears to load and cache their contents as well.
fields.summary: Menus are empty after clicking a file:/// link in IE

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When a user attempts to access JIRA on their Mobile Device, JIRA seems to be stuck in a loop while it is in the mobile view.

If the user switches this to the Desktop version on the mobile device, JIRA is able to load fine.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Access JIRA in your mobile phone browser.
#* Tested and verified on Android and customer confirmed issue occurs on iOS.
# Login to JIRA.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would show you the issues it contains in mobile view.

h5. Actual Behavior 

JIRA would keep refreshing automatically in some cases it would attempt and then go back to the login screen where it would ask for username and password again without throwing any errors.

h5. Workaround

Switch the launching of JIRA to the desktop mode and login from there on your mobile device.
fields.summary: JIRA on Mobile in Mobile View Loops

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
While importing a CSV file into existing project (defined in CSV), an error message about invalid project key appears after mapping the value. However, the project key is correctly defined in the CSV file and correctly mapped. The actual problem is with the project name but the error message could mislead the admins.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
h4. Scenario 1: There is a leading or trailing space in the project name
# Create a project named *DESK * (with a trailing space) and project key as *DESK*.
# Create CSV file below. 
{noformat}
Project Name,Project Key,Summary
DESK,DESK,CSV bug
{noformat}
# Go to {{Administration > System > External System Import > CSV}} and import the CSV file.
# Map the fields accordingly to import the issue.

h4. Scenario 2: Case sensitive
# Create CSV file below. 
{noformat}
Project Name,Project Key,Summary
Desk,DESK,CSV bug
{noformat}
# Go to {{Administration > System > External System Import > CSV}} and import the CSV file.
# Map the fields accordingly to import the issue.

h3. Expected result
The CSV file is imported successfully.

h3. Actual result
It's not possible to proceed after mapping the fields as the error below occurs on the screen. 
{{Invalid project key DESK: Project key or name is already used. If you want to import to an existing project the name and the key must match it exactly.}}

h3. Workaround
* To identify if there's any leading or trailing space in the project name, use the SQL query below. The name can then be changed via the UI to eliminate the space.
{code:SQL}
select * from project where pname like ' %' or pname like '% ';
{code}
* Make sure the project name value in the CSV file is exactly the same as per the project name.
fields.summary: The "Invalid project key" error shown during CSV import is misleading

fields.description:
*Actual behaviour*

When JIRA is having  problem replicating ehcache changes, one will see all ehcache-replicator  threads stuck in calls like this
{noformat}
ehcache-replicator-10 State: RUNNABLE tid: 59
java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(FileDescriptor, byte[], int, int, int) SocketInputStream.java
java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(FileDescriptor, byte[], int, int, int) SocketInputStream.java:116
java.net.SocketInputStream.read(byte[], int, int, int) SocketInputStream.java:171
java.net.SocketInputStream.read(byte[], int, int) SocketInputStream.java:141
java.io.BufferedInputStream.fill() BufferedInputStream.java:246
java.io.BufferedInputStream.read() BufferedInputStream.java:265
java.io.DataInputStream.readByte() DataInputStream.java:265
sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPChannel.createConnection() TCPChannel.java:246
sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPChannel.newConnection() TCPChannel.java:202
sun.rmi.server.UnicastRef.newCall(RemoteObject, Operation[], int, long) UnicastRef.java:342
sun.rmi.registry.RegistryImpl_Stub.lookup(String)
java.rmi.Naming.lookup(String) Naming.java:101
net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMICacheManagerPeerProvider.lookupRemoteCachePeer(String) RMICacheManagerPeerProvider.java:127
com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider.lambda$getCachePeerAsync$2(String) JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider.java:76
com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider$$Lambda$45.get()
com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.ClassLoaderSwitchingSupplier.get() ClassLoaderSwitchingSupplier.java:20
java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.run() CompletableFuture.java:1590
java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker) ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142
java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run() ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617
java.lang.Thread.run() Thread.java:748
{noformat}
Many threads will be stuck in BlockingCache.acquiredLockForKey. They try to get data from ehcache. 
 Stack traces at the moment of snapshot capture:
{noformat}
http-nio-8080-exec-799 url:/  [DAEMON] State: RUNNABLE tid: 3280645
java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$Sync.fullTryAcquireShared(Thread) ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:547
java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$Sync.tryAcquireShared(int) ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:488
java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireShared(int) AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1282
java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$ReadLock.lock() ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:727
net.sf.ehcache.concurrent.ReadWriteLockSync.lock(LockType) ReadWriteLockSync.java:50
net.sf.ehcache.constructs.blocking.BlockingCache.acquiredLockForKey(Object, Sync, LockType) BlockingCache.java:196
net.sf.ehcache.constructs.blocking.BlockingCache.get(Object) BlockingCache.java:158
com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.get(Object) LoadingCache.java:75
net.sf.ehcache.constructs.blocking.BlockingCache.get(Serializable) BlockingCache.java:318
com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCachedReference.get() DelegatingCachedReference.java:62
com.atlassian.jira.security.GlobalPermissionsCache.hasPermission(GlobalPermissionEntry) GlobalPermissionsCache.java:57
com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultGlobalPermissionManager.hasPermission(GlobalPermissionEntry) DefaultGlobalPermissionManager.java:419
...
com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultGlobalPermissionManager.hasPermissionIgnoreRecovery(GlobalPermissionKey, ApplicationUser) DefaultGlobalPermissionManager.java:308
com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultGlobalPermissionManager.hasPermission(GlobalPermissionKey, ApplicationUser) DefaultGlobalPermissionManager.java:270
com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultGlobalPermissionManager.hasPermission(int, ApplicationUser) DefaultGlobalPermissionManager.java:264
com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultPermissionManager.hasPermission(int, ApplicationUser) DefaultPermissionManager.java:81
com.atlassian.jira.security.ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager.hasPermission(int, ApplicationUser) ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager.java:60
...
{noformat}
*Expected behaviour*
 Ehcache updates should not block gets.

*Cause*
DefaultGlobalPermissionManager is using cached reference which means all threads need to fight for single ReentrantReadWriteLock. Single view issue for user with 150 groups can generate over 55k accesses to this cache.  This lock uses CAS and as a result high contention may kill its performance. Our tests show that with 200 concurrent threads performance degrades 1000 times
fields.summary: [Data Center] Lock contention on ehcache in DefaultGlobalPermissionManager under high load with many users

fields.description:
Dear JIRA team,

 

We have round about 150 JIRA projects and about 2.000 users working on it. User authorization has to be done by the JIRA global admin but currently the user authorizaion permission is included in "Administer projects" and therefore an open door for all project admins.

 

We have to give the "Administer projects" access right to all project admins as they need the possibility to work with components and versions (useful functions by the way).

Unfortunatetly, project leaders also use this role to change users and change permissions. As you can imagine, this causes a lot of problems.
||Project permissions||
|| ||*Explanation*||
|Administer projects|Permission to administer a project in JIRA. This includes the ability to edit [{color:#0066cc}project role membership{color}|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/managing-project-role-membership-828787789.html], [{color:#0066cc}project components{color}|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/managing-components-829827054.html], [{color:#0066cc}project versions{color}|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/managing-versions-829827068.html], and some [{color:#0066cc}project details{color}|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/defining-a-project-828787707.html] ('Project Name', 'URL', 'Project Lead', 'Project Description').|

 

+*Improvement:*+

It would be better to create a new project permission "user authorizaion" that contains all authoriziation topics (define project lead, change / add / delete users to groups).

 
||Project permissions||
|| ||*Explanation*||
|Administer projects|Permission to administer a project in JIRA. This includes the ability to edit {color:#ff0000}-[project role membership|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/managing-project-role-membership-828787789.html]-{color}, +{color:#333333}[project components|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/managing-components-829827054.html]{color}+, {color:#333333}[project versions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/managing-versions-829827068.html]{color}, and some {color:#333333}[project details|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/defining-a-project-828787707.html]{color} ('Project Name', 'URL', -{color:#ff0000}'Project Lead'{color}-, 'Project Description').|
|{color:#8eb021}User authorization *NEW*{color}|{color:#8eb021}project role membership, Project lead{color}|

 

This would be helpful for more than 2.000 users in our company and aswell thousands worlwide. Thanks a lot and best regards,

Peter
fields.summary: IMPORTANT: Admin panel - Administer projects

fields.description:
As an Agile/Kanban user, I'm sure we're not the only ones using physical Kanban boards.

The *Print cards* functionality within Jira's Kanban is _so_ close to being useful. Besides, not being configurable, I don't understand why it is just *slightly* different from the dimensions of the universal and ubiquitous 3x3" sticky Post-it Note.

This seems like an *easy win* and an *easy fix*, it completely baffles me to why Atlassian chooses to ignore what could help many of its users. 

(Yes I know there is an Agile Cards app available for a _cost_ in the Marketplace)
fields.summary: Default Print cards from Kanban to the popular 3x3" Sticky Post-It

fields.description:
JIRA graph types are rather limited, and one that would be especially useful is the Gantt stype graph from Confluence.

it would need a few tweaks, e.g. to allow assignment of which Fields should be applied to which component (e.g. Planned Start and End, Actual Start and End, % complete) but would I suspect be quite easy to add and incredibly useful for people wanting to set up a JIRA dashboard that shows at a glance, visually, the progress on a number of tasks.
fields.summary: JIRA graphs - could the Gantt graph macro from Confluence be made available in JIRA ?

fields.description:
This comes about because it is common in our organisation for administrators to have another (primary) role such as software developer, and as such they typically do not want to belong to every group under the sun, as that would result in filters designed to pick up tasks assigned to members of a specific team also picking up theirs.

To give a concrete example, programmer A is on team X, working on a specific product, and sees that there is a useful filter he can create which would be helpful not only to his own team but also to the product management team, which he is not a member of.  However he cannot share his own filter with the product management team, and nobody on the product management team could share it with the programmer team either, because they are not members of that.  However programmer A is a JIRA admin, so by adding a "permission to share outside of your own groups" that can be assigned to a specific role, it would be possible to assign this permission to all JIRA admins, and then programmer A would be allowed to select from groups he does not belong to.
fields.summary: Flter sharing - could there be an additional permission for administrators to allow sharing with groups they do not belong to ?

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The processing of the outgoing mail queue is single threaded and can get delayed (making the notifications to pile up in the queue) due to the thread (processing the notifications) taking a long time to calculate what had changed in an issue before the notification is sent out.
See also other related issue:  JRASERVER-61543

h3. Environment
I have reproduced the issue in:
 * JIRA 7.2.8
 * Outgoing mail enabled

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable outgoing mail
 # Create a test project
 # Create some issues to the project inserting in any of the multi-text fields a very long text (approximately 300000 characters).
 # Edit one or more of the issues created by deleting the 300000 from the multi-text field and just pasting the first 1000 characters (from the long text of 300000 characters)
 # When the notification is being sent the thread processing it will be take some time to calculate the difference of what change in the issue and will have the same stack trace as the one detailed in the description of the bug above.

 
h3. Expected Results
The thread processing the notifications should process the differences faster or it should have a time out that can be configured by the administrator so when it takes a certain time to process a notification a template notification (such as "Too many things have change in this issue" or similar) is sent instead of spending a long time in calculating the changes.
The administrator should be able to switch the time out on/off as well as being able to set the max time out interval.

 
h3. Actual Results
The processing of the outgoing mail queue gets delayed, making the notifications to pile up in the queue and affecting the performance of it.

The thread processing the notification will have the below stack trace:
{code}
 "Sending mailitem com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem@682a8028[issue=com.atlassian.jira.issue.IssueImpl@5122ec89[id=837382,summary=Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit ,key=PROJ-123,created=2017-01-06 19:27:14.107,updated=2017-08-18 05:50:47.763,assignee=user1(user1),reporter=user2(user2)],remoteUser=user3(user3),notificationType=Current_Assignee,eventTypeId=2,templateId=2]" #182 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x0000000058c36800 nid=0x1600 runnable [0x000000006631b000]
 java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
 at org.apache.commons.jrcs.diff.myers.MyersDiff.buildPath(MyersDiff.java:129)
 at org.apache.commons.jrcs.diff.myers.MyersDiff.diff(MyersDiff.java:93)
 at org.apache.commons.jrcs.diff.Diff.diff(Diff.java:197)
 at com.atlassian.diff.WordLevelDiffer.diffWords(WordLevelDiffer.java:101)
 at com.atlassian.diff.WordLevelDiffer.diffLine(WordLevelDiffer.java:91)
 at com.atlassian.diff.DiffViewBean.createWordLevelDiff(DiffViewBean.java:108)
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.DiffUtils.diff(DiffUtils.java:19)
 at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
 at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
 at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
 at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
 at org.apache.velocity.util.introspection.UberspectImpl$VelMethodImpl.doInvoke(UberspectImpl.java:385)
 at org.apache.velocity.util.introspection.UberspectImpl$VelMethodImpl.invoke(UberspectImpl.java:374)
 at com.atlassian.velocity.htmlsafe.introspection.UnboxingMethod.invoke(UnboxingMethod.java:30)
...
 at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.writeEncodedBodyForContent(DefaultVelocityManager.java:86)
 at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest.toWriterImpl(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:129)
 at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest.asPlainText(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:108)
 at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest$1.with(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:92)
 at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest$StringRepresentation.toString(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:77)
 at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest.asPlainText(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:94)
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.builder.EmailRenderer.renderEmailBody(EmailRenderer.java:103)
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.builder.EmailRenderer.render(EmailRenderer.java:150)
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.builder.EmailBuilder.renderNow(EmailBuilder.java:155)
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.builder.EmailBuilder.renderNowAsQueueItem(EmailBuilder.java:145)
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.MailingListCompiler$1.evaluateEmailForRecipient(MailingListCompiler.java:336)
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.NotificationRecipientProcessor.evaluateEmails(NotificationRecipientProcessor.java:39)
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.MailingListCompiler.evaluateEmails(MailingListCompiler.java:267)
...
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.MailingListCompiler.prepareEmail(MailingListCompiler.java:170)
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.MailingListCompiler.sendLists(MailingListCompiler.java:101)
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem.send(IssueMailQueueItem.java:128)
 at com.atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl.sendBufferUnderLock(MailQueueImpl.java:103)
 at com.atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl.sendBuffer(MailQueueImpl.java:56)
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.JiraMailQueue$1.apply(JiraMailQueue.java:51)
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.JiraMailQueue$1.apply(JiraMailQueue.java:48)
 at com.atlassian.jira.util.velocity.DefaultVelocityRequestContextFactory.runWithStaticBaseUrl(DefaultVelocityRequestContextFactory.java:110)
 at com.atlassian.jira.util.DefaultBaseUrl.runWithStaticBaseUrl(DefaultBaseUrl.java:50)
 at com.atlassian.jira.mail.JiraMailQueue.sendBuffer(JiraMailQueue.java:48)
 at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailQueueService.run(MailQueueService.java:21)
...
 at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.run(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:34)
 at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
 {code}
 
h3. Workaround
Flushing the queue can help to ease the problem as it add another thread to process notifications.
(!) Please note that you shouldn't flush the queue more then once, since it will use more Caesium (scheduler) threads. 

h3. Additional Notes

It is very important to note that the bigger the difference between the original text in the multi-line text field and what it was updated then the longer the diff libraries will take to process what it was change.
For example comparing 1000 characters vs 300000 characters will take longer than comparing 240000 characters vs 300000 characters as the difference is smaller in the second comparison.
fields.summary: Outgoing mail queue processing is delayed due to thread taking a long time to process what  was changed in an issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With JIRA running on MSSQL, when you try to delete a project that is tied with an issue that has more than 2000 parameters markers, i.e: comments, JIRA doesn't successfully delete it. Through the UI it says it was removed and you can acknowledge it, the project will not appear on the regular dashboard panel, but the project will still be on the admin dashboard management page and on the database, missing a few schemes.

h3. How to reproduce
* JIRA 7.3.1 or JIRA 7.5 running on MSSQL
* Have an issue with more than 2000 comments (2100 on major MSSQL version > 7)
* Try to delete this project

h3. Actual Result
When trying to delete the project, eventually the following error will be logged:

{code}
secure/project/DeleteProject.jspa [c.a.jira.project.DefaultProjectManager] Exception removing issues
com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught SQLServerException for delete from dbo.jiraaction
where jiraaction.id in (?, ?, ?, ?.... 
	at com.querydsl.sql.DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.java:50)
	at com.querydsl.sql.Configuration.translate(Configuration.java:459)
	at com.querydsl.sql.dml.SQLDeleteClause.execute(SQLDeleteClause.java:222)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.comments.DefaultCommentManager.lambda$deleteCommentsForIssue$4(DefaultCommentManager.java:418)
	at com.atlassian.jira.database.DbConnectionManagerImpl.execute(DbConnectionManagerImpl.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.comments.DefaultCommentManager.deleteCommentsForIssue(DefaultCommentManager.java:416)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueDeleteHelper.removeChildActions(DefaultIssueDeleteHelper.java:172)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueDeleteHelper.deleteIssue(DefaultIssueDeleteHelper.java:140)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueDeleteHelper.deleteIssueNoEvent(DefaultIssueDeleteHelper.java:182)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.deleteIssueNoEvent(DefaultIssueManager.java:748)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.RequestCachingIssueManager.deleteIssueNoEvent(RequestCachingIssueManager.java:252)
	at com.atlassian.jira.project.DefaultProjectManager.removeProjectIssues(DefaultProjectManager.java:420)
	at com.atlassian.jira.project.CachingProjectManager.removeProjectIssues(CachingProjectManager.java:197
Caused by: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The incoming request has too many parameters. The server supports a maximum of 2100 parameters. Reduce the number of parameters and resend the request.
{code}

Or 

{code}java.sql.SQLException: Prepared or callable statement has more than 2000 parameter markers.{code}

The delete request may appear to have succeeded, but the project won't be deleted from the database and still be visible at the admin manage dashboard page. Since the deletion was only partial, the permission scheme may be disassociated:

{code}No permission scheme is associated with project 'xxx'{code}


h3. Expected results
JIRA should delete the project, treating any issues regarding the error mentioned on this ticket prior to deleting the project.

h3. Workaround
Delete the issues that are preventing the project to be deleted.
fields.summary: Cannot delete a project if tied with an issue with more than 2000 comments on MSSQL

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
If the database permissions are not granted as per Atlassian recommendations, it is very likely to hit into the issue where it's not possible to set up the administrator account with the message {{Cannot add user, all the user directories are read-only}} on the account setup page. The message does not help user to understand what is causing the issue and how to resolve it.

h3. Suggestion
Provide more context on the {{Cannot add user, all the user directories are read-only}} message to the user on the screen. For example, tips on the screen to suggest the user to check the database permissions and Supported Platforms.
fields.summary: Better warning message for "Cannot add user, all the user directories are read-only"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
 
{panel}
Currently our [Installing JIRA on Linux|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+on+Linux#InstallingJIRAonLinux-PerforminganUnattendedInstallation] docs contain info on how to use the file however not the structure of it. Can you please add some information about the breakdown of the files? For example what this stuff means:
{noformat}
backupJira$Boolean=true
executeLauncherAction$Boolean=true
app.install.service$Boolean=false
existingInstallationDir=/srv/jira/app
sys.confirmedUpdateInstallationString=false
sys.languageId=en
sys.installationDir=/srv/jira/app
{noformat}
TYVM. :)

 

Above is the original ticket, JIRASERVER-36002. The ticket points to a link on unattended installs. *But* the ticket specifically asks for the structure of the response file, not how to do an unattended install. What do the different keys in the response file mean? What all all the different types of keys available? Etc.
fields.summary: Add documentation for the response.varfile used in the Linux Bundled Installer

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Specifically when using the Project Key "TRY" in JIRA and linking this project to a Confluence space, everytime a new page is added to that space containing the words "Try, trying, try etc", the page appears in every issue activity stream for that project.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.4.1
* Confluence 6.3.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an application link between JIRA and Confluence
# Create a project in JIRA with the project key "TRY"
#  Link the Confluence space to the JIRA project
#  Add a new product requirement or any page in Confluence containing any word with  "Try". Do not mention issue Key.
# Go to any Issue in that project
# Look at the activity stream for every issue in that project, it will show the page added in all the issues for that project.


h3. Expected Results
The page should appear only in mentioned issues.

h3. Actual Results
The page will appear in the activity stream for every issue in that project "TRY" if there is the word "trying" anywhere in the page.

h3. Notes
This is specifically happening when using the Project Key "TRY", it seems the activity stream is making search requests looking for all the content containing the issue key, and that search returns any page with the word "try" even though it is not being mentioned as an issue key.


h3.Workaround
Renaming the project addresses the issue, the pages are removed from the issues activity stream.
fields.summary: Confluence adds entries in the activity stream for every issue in linked project

fields.description:
When you have more than projects it possible that you will more than one entries in the development panel. 

We would like to configure this view to show the project name as well.

For example, we have three related projects

* core library
* backend web service
* front end
Sometimes a particular feature touches all three of them and three separate branches are created with same name in each project. At that point, you will see three entries here with exactly name name in the title section. You have no quick way to understand which PR belongs to which project other than hovering your mouse for couple of seconds until your browser shows the link at the status bar.
fields.summary: Show the project name in pull request view of a Jira ticket

fields.description:
Customers are increasing their integration to JIRA and other Atlassian products and are asking us for swagger.json to simplify integration across systems. Currently there is not an official swagger.json from Atlassian that is available for JIRA Server.

Similar endpoint that Bitbucket has implemented: https://bitbucket.org/api/swagger.json
fields.summary: Provide swagger.json definition for JIRA Server to simplify integration

fields.description:
If a user tries to access a dashboard on a mobile screen, their experience depends on whether or not the browser is configured for "desktop" mode:
 * If in desktop mode, the page has a large banner - which cannot be dismissed - recommending use of the mobile version.
 * If in mobile mode, dashboards are not available - JIRA forces the user onto mobile pages, e.g. a list of issues.

Please support dashboards in mobile views and also please make the "mobile banner" dismissable so that the desktop view can be used to some degree on small screens.
fields.summary: Support dashboards in mobile JIRA views

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When clicking the "Login & Approve" link for newly created Applinks in JIRA Reports, nothing happens. Tokens were not generated.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.3.0
Confluence 6.1.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create the applink between JIRA and Confluence
# Use OAuth authentication
# Go to Confluence and click on the 3 dots beside the *Create* button
# Select a Space and choose JIRA Report
# Click on Change Log and you will see the *Login & Approve* link
[^report.png]

h3. Expected Behaviour
You will be redirected to a page where you can click "Allow" read/write access to the application
[^allow.png]

h3. Actual Result
Nothing happens

h3. Workaround
# Go to a Confluence page and click Edit
# Click on the '+' sign and select JIRA Issue/Filter
# Click on the Login & Approve link here in order for the token to be generated
fields.summary: Nothing Happens when Clicking the "Login & Approve" link in JIRA Report

When user try to move files from one Window to another window and the file passes the Firefox browser which displaying issue page, the issue page will be stuck on the "drag and drop" mode.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Open JIRA and access an issue page.
2. Open 2 Explorer window in Windows and leave a gap in between the explorer.

4. Drag a file from the first explorer to the second explorer.

JIRA 7.4.3

Mozilla Firefox 54 & 55

Firefox is not stuck in "drag and drop" mode.


h3. Actual Results

Firefox is stuck in "drag and drop" mode.

Refresh the issue page

fields.description:
Right now, when changes are made on an Issue, those changes are listed one by one in the History tab. 

It would be helpful to have the ability to specify two dates, then JIRA would show the collective set of changes between those dates as a side-by-side comparison. 

With the current functionality, it can be difficult to get a sense for all the changes that were made since specific dates/events took place, such as when the issue went into triage.
fields.summary: Show Issue History between two points in time

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When a user open the screen to create a new ticket, on the assignee field he can click on the dropdown arrow to show all users. If the user type anything, it will filter user accounts matching his filter. But if he removes his filter clearing the field, click outside the dropdown, and click on the dropdown again, it will only show the previously filtered names again, not the expected "all users".
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Click the "Create" button to create a ticket
# Go to the Assignee field and click on the dropdown arrow. It will show "Suggestions" and "All users" as results.
# Now, type a letter, i.e. "J" on the field, and the dropdown will show filtered accounts with the letter "J" on it, matching the filter.
# Clear the Assignee field, removing anything you've typed, and click outside the dropdown.
# Click again on the dropdown arrow. It will shows "Suggestions" and "All users", but will only show the previously filtered accounts, not all accounts as expected.

h3. Expected Results
When clearing the Assignee field after a filtered search and clicking outside the Assignee field, when you click on the dropdown arrow, it will show "All users" again.

h3. Actual Results
When clearing the Assignee field after a filtered search and clicking outside the Assignee field, when you click on the dropdown arrow, the dropdown arrow only shows the previously filtered accounts below the "All users" tag.

h3. Workaround
When you clear the Assignee field, do not click outside the field and click straight into the dropdown arrow. It will shows the expected results.
fields.summary: Assignee filter dropdown does not clear previous filter to show all users again

fields.description:
h3. Problem

As per the documentation and in previous JIRA version, the instance should not be usable while lock reindexing is running. However, in JIRA 7.4.3, I was able to access the instance and transition an issue while performing lock reindexing.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login as an admin and go to Administration > System > Indexing
 # Choose Lock JIRA and rebuild index
 # On another tab, login as another user
 # Go to one of the issues and transition it

h3. Expected Behaviour

Users should not be able to access the instance
h3. Actual Behaviour

Users can login and transition issues
h3. Access Logs
{code:java}
0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 1380x1164x1 admin [11/Sep/2017:23:01:16 +0800] "GET /jira_743/secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa?id=10300&action=11&atl_token=B2ZH-39NA-1BZH-ZON8|b97be39554bbeb92427f5fddbfe6ff9202088d3d|lin&decorator=dialog&inline=true&_=1505142044562 HTTP/1.1" 200 86 31353 "http://localhost:8743/jira_743/browse/BUS-1" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/60.0.3112.113 Safari/537.36" "1jm5vzn"
{code}
fields.summary: Lock Reindexing Allows Issue Transition

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

If JIRA Data Center is integrated with SSO using SAML as secondary authentication, the login gadget will be missing when JIRA is restarted.
h3. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Integrate JIRA Data Center with SSO using SAML as secondary authentication
 # Restart JIRA

h3. +Expected behavior+

Login gadget is available
h3. +Actual behavior+

Login gadget is missing:
 !logingadgetmissing.png|thumbnail!
h3. +Notes+
 * _jira.disable.login.gadget_ is not set to true in JIRA_Home/jira-config.properties (or jpm.xml)
 * When JIRA is restarted, this parameter however is set to true automatically, which can be seen from System Info

h3. +Workaround+

(+) If possible, use SAML as primary authentication.
 * Alternatively, use the login page instead: _<JIRA_BaseURL>/login.jsp_ (click Log In on the rightmost of the top navigation bar)

(i) If the gadget must be displayed, toggle SAML configuration:
# Go to SAML settings and disable SAML (use Login form only)
# Log out of JIRA and go to <Base_URL>/secure/Dashboard.jspa, ensuring that the login gadget now appears
# Log in JIRA and configure SAML again, setting it to Secondary
# Log out of JIRA and go to <Base_URL>/secure/Dashboard.jspa, confirming that the login gadget still appears
(-) The gadget will be missing again when JIRA is restarted, though.
fields.summary: Login gadget is missing upon JIRA restart

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If a user attempts to use the Where is My Field functionality to check for the location of the Creator field, they get the following error:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

If they check the screen used by the project, they would not be able to add the creator field to the create screen.

h5. Steps to Reproduce.

# Attempt to create a new issue in the Issue Pop-Up.
# Press the *Where is My Field* link.
# Select the *creator* field.
#* You should see the error in the screen shot above.
# Go to the screen associated with the create screen you tested earlier.
# Select configure and attempt to add the Creator field to the screen.

h5. Expected behavior

User would either be able to add the field to the screen, not have the field in the Where is My Field pop-up or have an appropriate notification letting them know they cannot add the field to the screen in the error shown in the screen shot we shared.

h5. Actual behavior

JIRA provides a misleading error that the user has not added the field to the screen and they should go to the Screen page to add the field.
fields.summary: Misleading Error Message for Where Is My Field

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When you access the profile page when your JIRA language is set to German, some of the text in the profile page overlap with the value section.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to {{Admin > System > General Configuration}} page.
# Change the JIRA server settings language to German.
# Save your changes.
# Go to the user profile page.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would automatically adjust the section width based on  the character length.

h5. Actual Behavior

JIRA does not handle the CSS for the sections properly which results in the text characters of the label overlapping with the other ones for the value.
fields.summary: Language Label Overlapping Text

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The JIRA Mail handler will create new issues with the priority based on the X-Priority entry in the email.

If the email has no priority set, the resulting issue will be created with the default priority. Emails that has been flagged as high priority will be created in JIRA with a priority higher than the default ones while the opposite happens with low priority emails.

There is currently no option to turn this off and enforce all tickets to be created with the default priority

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow this functionality to be switched off.

h3. Workaround
The 3rd party plugin [Enterprise Email Handler for JIRA (JEMH)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.javahollic.jira.jemh-ui/cloud/overview] has the functionality to enforce the priority of the issue as mentioned here: [How to change the priority of an issue|https://thepluginpeople.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/JEMH/pages/49184800/How+to+change+the+priority+of+an+issue].
fields.summary: Make it possible to turn off the JIRA Mail Handler's functionality to set issue priority based on mail priority

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

In JIRA 7.5, there're a few issues with uploading attachments on a transition screen. These issues make attachment management unreliable, affecting JIRA notifications as well as add-ons that rely on attachment related events.
h3. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Install JIRA 7.5
 # Configure a workflow transition in which:
 ** A validator is set e.g. user must have Delete All Attachments permission to perform the transition (but any permission or validator will do)
 ** An event is triggerred from a postfunction e.g. Generic Event, Issue Updated event
 ** A transition screen is popped up that includes the Attachment field
 # Configure the permission scheme so that Delete All Attachments permission is NOT granted to anyone (the purpose is to *Fail* the validator)
 # Transition an issue using the transition in step #2 following these steps:
 ** Click the transition button to show the transition screen
 ** Attach a file to the Attachment field and transition (refer below for the Behaviors)
 # Configure the permission scheme so that Delete All Attachments permission is granted to your user account (the purpose is to *Pass* the validator)
 # Repeat step #4

h3. +Expected behaviors+
 * At step #4, since the Validator fails, the attachment is NOT added to the issue
 * At step #6, since the Validator passes, the attachment is added and the notification event should record this - works in JIRA 7.4:
 !attachEvent7.4.png|thumbnail!

h3. +Actual behaviors+
 * At step #4, the Validator fails, however the attachment is still ADDED to the issue
 * At step #6, the Validator passes and the event is fired, however the email doesn't show that an attachment was added:
 !attachEvent7.5.png|thumbnail!

h3. +Notes+
 * When a file is attached to the Attachment field on the transition screen, JIRA logs the followings:
{code:java}
2017-09-25 17:59:17,155 http-nio-8080-exec-13 WARN admin 1079x1482x1 14y3zz0 10.60.2.10 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [c.a.j.web.util.DefaultWebAttachmentManager] Temporary attachment missing: temp6551281033883185756
2017-09-25 17:59:17,155 http-nio-8080-exec-13 WARN admin 1079x1482x1 14y3zz0 10.60.2.10 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [c.a.j.issue.fields.AttachmentSystemField] There were errors while converting temporary attachments: AttachmentError{logMessage='Temporary attachment missing: temp6551281033883185756', localizedMessage='Unable to find temporary attachment.', filename='#temp6551281033883185756', reason=SERVER_ERROR, exception=none()}
{code}

 * According to [~fcarmario@gmail.com], the potential cause is:
{quote}Method *getTemporaryWebAttachment* of *TemporaryWebAttachmentManager* doesn't return any *TemporaryWebAttachment* since version 7.5.0 of JIRA. In previous versions it worked correctly.
 I have also tried method *getTemporaryWebAttachmentsByFormToken* as a possible alternative but it doesn't work too.
{quote}
(+) Fidel also points out the problematic code here.

 * When a file is attached using More -> Attach files, there's NO problem (/)
 * There're reports that, at step #6, not only does the email not show that an attachment was added, but the added attachment also does not appear in the Issue's History (!)
fields.summary: getTemporaryWebAttachment doesn't return any TemporaryWebAttachment

fields.description:
In JSD 3.7 Atlassian has introduced canned responses (https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-7-x-release-notes-934718353.html#JIRAServiceDesk3.7.xreleasenotes-Cannedresponses)
This feature would be a great addition in JIRA Software and JIRA Core too. Can you please enable it for JIRA-instances without JSD?

fields.description:
[JIRA 7.5.x Supported platforms - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/supported-platforms-935390828.html] for the section on MS SQL database support notes that we are using the JTDS driver for these databases.
{quote}Supported Microsoft SQL Server databases use [the latest JTDS JDBC driver listed here|http://jtds.sourceforge.net/].
{quote}
However the [JIRA 7.5.x platform upgrade notes - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjira/jira-platform-releases/jira-7-5-x-platform-upgrade-notes] note that we have switched 7.5 to use the official MS database driver. This document should be updated to reflect this change for JIRA 7.5 and future releases going forward.

 See also [JRASERVER-45754|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45754?src=confmacro&_ga=2.154035697.818249210.1504622480-1350541925.1466023970]
fields.summary: JIRA 7.5 supported platforms lists the jtds database driver for ms sql

fields.description:
One of the features of the JIRA user server is the ability to restrict application logins to selected IP addresses. Unfortunately, this functionality breaks if the connecting application access JIRA through a proxy or WAF, such as Apache, Nginx, Amazon ELB or Cloudflare. In these cases, it is necessary to specify the IP address of the proxy, rather than the actual IP address of the remote application. Although obvious in hindsight, this may not be readily apparent when setting the user server up, nor is it mentioned in the documentation ( [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/connecting-to-crowd-or-another-jira-application-for-user-management-881683375.html] ).

While it is simple enough to specify the address(es) of the proxy in the allowed IP address area, this essentially bypasses the restrictions as any client able to connect to the proxy is able to access the user server facility (assuming the password is known and no special configuration is in place on the proxy).

One trait of most (or all) proxy applications is that they add headers indicating what the originating host's IP address was (Apache uses X-Forwarded-For, Cloudflare uses CF-Connecting-IP). While these headers can't be trusted by default, the ability to define the topology of connections would make this facility more useful. This configuration might resemble the following:
Allowed IP addresses: ELB IP
X-Forwarded-For: WAF IPs
WAF-Source-IP: Application endpoints

I wasn't certain if this was actually an embedded crowd issue or not, so I took my best guess on where to file the issue.
fields.summary: User server facility fails to properly restrict proxied connections

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, JQL functions follows user's timezone, especially for time/date related function or specified date, for example
{code}
startOfDay()
endOfDay()
2017-01-01 5:00
{code}

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to configure what timezone to follow, so the result of JQL filter being run by different users in different timezone will be the same.
fields.summary: Having the option to configure JQL to follow server timezone instead of user's timezone

fields.description:
Hi!

The problem is described here:

[Notification emails don't contain correct From address |https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/notification-emails-don-t-contain-correct-from-address-306348474.html]

The proposed solution is to make a configuration that will allow to configure both the From address and Reply-To address. Clients with Outlook+AD(or Office365) then will provide the real email address in the Reply-To header, and a fake, non-existent in Address Book email address in the From header. Once Outlook sees that From email is not present in Address Book, it will display the correct user name from the header.

This workaround could be implemented not only for JIRA, but for other applications.

Cheers
fields.summary: workaround for Outlook+AD email notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If some user has many favourite filters, REST API call {{/rest/api/2/filter/favourite}} triggered by him will use large amount of memory (200MB+) and that causes high JVM memory pressure. In case of many simultaneous requests this could cause OOM and JVM/JIRA crash. 

h3. Environment
* User with many favourite filters: 100+ 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create many filters
# Register the filters as your favourite ones
# Open Issue Navigator (check left sidebar)
#* or do REST API call {{/rest/api/2/filter/favourite}} directly 

h3. Expected Results
No performance problem happens.

h3. Actual Results
JVM heap memory pressure (causes FullGC).  Specific thread can allocate 200MB+ of memory. 
 
h3. Notes
* Thread dump will show the following stack-trace for the thread which loads {{/rest/api/2/filter/favourite}}, part related to _com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.FilterBean_
{noformat}
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.UserListResolver.getShareCount(UserListResolver.java:137)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.UserBeanListWrapper.<init>(UserBeanListWrapper.java:40)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.FilterBeanBuilder.build(FilterBeanBuilder.java:173)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.FilterResource$SearchRequestToFilterBean.apply(FilterResource.java:650)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.FilterResource$SearchRequestToFilterBean.apply(FilterResource.java:622)
	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$8.next(Iterators.java:812)
	at com.google.common.collect.Lists.newArrayList(Lists.java:139)
	at com.google.common.collect.Lists.newArrayList(Lists.java:119)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.FilterResource.getFavouriteFilters(FilterResource.java:422)
..
{noformat}
* Each _FilterBean_  object (corresponds to _favourite filter_) is around 2.8MB, so having 100 of them will use ~300MB of memory. 
* Heap dump will show large memory consumed by _org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread_
** Snippet from dominator tree with 350 _favourite filters_: 
|| Object / Stack Frame |Name  | Shallow Heap | Retained Heap ||
|org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread @ 0x235d499d8|http-nio-8080-exec-1061 url:/jira/rest/api/2/filter/f...  |          128 |   961,473,680 |
|org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread @ 0x235d49b98|http-nio-8080-exec-1059 url:/jira/rest/api/2/filter/f...  |          128 |   863,698,080 |

h3.Workaround
*  Reduce number of favourite filters
*  Set dark feature {{com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.UserListResolver.getShareCount.disabled}} flag, that will always return _sharedUsers.size: 0_ in JSON response, eg:
{noformat}
sharedUsers: {
 size: 0,
 items: [ ],
 max-results: 1000,
 start-index: 0,
 end-index: 0
},
{noformat}
*- (!) API break. Since after change {{/rest/api/2/filter/favourite}} API doesn't return a correct number of the share count there is a risk that it will affect some other functionality. 

h3. Note on fix 
* The issue was work-arounded in 7.2.12, 7.6.1 and 7.7 by introducing an extra query param _enableSharedUsers_ to {{/rest/api/2/filter/favourite}} and {{/rest/api/2/filter/id}} to show that users shouldn't be calculated.
** By default, this param is true, so endpoints are fully backwards compatible. So that still can cause the mentioned problem 
** We've started using this param in JIRA itself ( issue-nav uses _enableSharedUsers=false_), so the problem should be fixed for JIRA.
fields.summary: Favourite filters REST Resource consumes large amount of memory when user has large number of filters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The current state of the [Upgrade hub|https://confluence.atlassian.com/ug/jira-software-upgrade-hub-933696737.html] (including the child pages) is not up-to-date with the JIRA 7.5 release.

Child pages are:
 * [Best practices guide for upgrading JIRA Software Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/ug/best-practices-guide-for-upgrading-jira-software-server-933696757.html]
 * [JIRA Software upgrade matrix|https://confluence.atlassian.com/ug/jira-software-upgrade-matrix-933696761.html]

h3. Suggested Solution

Update the content of the Upgrade Hub to include information about JIRA 7.5.
fields.summary: Upgrade Hub needs an update on JIRA 7.5 release

fields.description:
When migrating to a different workflow (with slightly different Statuses), JIRA asks you to associate current Status to New Status.  This list contains every single issue type in your environment, this means you have to look carefully through all of the 0's to find the issue types that actually do have issues in them.

This screen should display only issue types that contain issues inside of them.  See screenshot for example.
fields.summary: Migrating Workflows, Don't show unused Issue Types.

fields.description:
Currently the default field text like "Start typing to get a list of possible matches." is displayed under the fields, which takes up a lot of room, especially if you add field help text.

I think it would look a lot cleaner if the default field text was actually inside the field, where you type, but when you start typing it would disappear.

Attached is two screenshots, the first one shows how it looks right now in our project, and second one shows how it could look if the default field text was moved to be inside the field.
fields.summary: Generic field texts like "Start typing to get list..." should be inside the field instead of under it.

fields.description: h3. Problem Definition When you export issue(s) from JIRA into the Word format, the result shows HTML code embedded in user name fields. Example: {code:borderStyle=solid} Bobson, Bob {code} h3. Suggested Solution It would be helpful if there was a way to turn this off in JIRA when exporting issues to the Word format h3. Why this is important The hyperlink here is then able to take the viewer of this document back to the URL of the JIRA site. There are instances where you might share the word document with other parties to show this is being tracked, but do not want to provide them more information about your specific JIRA instance. h3. Workaround * If using JIRA 7.4.x or higher, you could use the HTML export option that would provide a very similar output, but without creating hyperlinks for username fields such as reporter/assignee. * The other export formats of XML, XLS (in JIRA 7.1.10 and before), CSV (in JIRA 7.2 and later), do not create this same kind of link on those fields
fields.summary: JIRA export to Word should not always create hyperlinks for username fields

fields.description:
Hello

We have 6 email address which our customers use to currently send support requests to us,  the email box effectively map to a issues type,  which we could then filter into queue.  The problem we have is a single service desktop project can not pick up from multiple mail boxes, it is restricted to 1,  and so I need to have 6 services desk projects.  We have  some support user who would then have to flick between  4 projects to see the queues, ( queue filters are restricted  to projects) .  this is unworkable .

This means we cant get a single view on all the queues which make management of service levels harder. 

I've tried moving ticket between queues based on and changing issues type manaully, with a view to scripting. I've tried flagging custom  fields which could be used to track the  email address ,  this does work.

The long and short of it , we will probably not our subscription in January for service desk because it can't  meet our simple needs.   We raised the issue in Jan/Feb with your selves and had not  solutions presented to,  there was dialogue saying you would consider for backlog etc. 

 

We're an Atlassian toolchain dev shop, so naturally we disappointed to have to move this business process out to another supplier/technology ,  we'll end up having to integrate the managEngine or similiar . 

I thought I give you the opportunity to respond before making the final decision .

 

Kind Regards 

Matt

CTO Pay360 by Capita 

[matt.hart@capita.co.uk|mailto:matt.hart@capita.co.uk]

+44 7971 683420
fields.summary: Service desk - multiple mailbox support

fields.description:
This suggestion has been separated from [JRASERVER-3821|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-3821] as a separate feature request which we'll prioritise independently. We will use all the comments around resolutions from the original suggestion ([JRASERVER-3821|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-3821]) in the design of the feature, so no need to put the same comments, just make sure to vote and watch the issue! We will provide further updates in here.

*Original Request*

As a JIRA Administrator I need more granular configuration for my projects.

Depending on the issue type, the resolution may be different. For example: in case of bugs, the resolution may be set to "fixed", but in case of improvements there is nothing to fix and the resolution should rather be "implemented". I need to be able to specify the default resolution separately per each issue type.
fields.summary: Resolutions per issue type

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you use the CSV export to export issues, you will see that the Rich text formatting is not maintained. That is, lists are not shown, texts are not bold or italicised etc. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to export to excel, while maintaining the rich text formatting in Excel. 

h3. Why this is important
For clarity and readability as the export file may be read by another user via Excel for analysis, rather than just using for import.
fields.summary: As a user, we would like to have an export to excel feature which maintains the formating in excel

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+
 * In JIRA 6.4.x (6.4.12 tested), renderedFields from Get Issue Rest API only include fields whose values can be displayed in HTML format (except a few special fields noted below).
 * In JIRA 7.x (tested in 7.3.5 and 7.4.3), renderedFields include all fields, and those whose values can't be displayed in HTML format will display *null*.

h3. +Steps to reproduce+

Hit this URL in the browser:
 * <JIRA_BaseURL>/rest/api/2/issue/<issue_ID_or_Key>?expand=renderedFields

h3. +Expected behavior+
 # Only fields whose values can be displayed in HTML format will be included in renderedFields
 # As per [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/issue-getIssue,] the field values should be in HTML format
bq. {{renderedFields}} - field values in HTML format

h3. +Actual behavior+

All fields are included and field values are displayed in an inconsistent manner:
 * Only _Description_ field value contains HTML tags (/)
 * _Date/Time_ field values seem to be displayed in plain text (!)
 * Special fields such as _Time Tracking_, _Attachment_, _Comment_, and _Worklog_ are displayed in JSON format (i)
 * Other field values return *null* e.g. _Project_, _Issue Type_, _Sprint_ (x)

h3. +Notes+
 * This seems to be a regression of JRASERVER-31418
 * Looks like non-text fields (whose values can't be displayed in HTML format) return *null*
 * _/rest/api/2/search?jql=key=<issueKey>&expand=renderedFields_ has the same behavior
fields.summary: renderedFields include Fields with Null values

fields.description: The JIRA 7.4 Supported Platforms page ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/supported-platforms-881683157.html)] lists that JIRA ships with the 9.1 postgres driver, which is incorrect. JIRA 7.4 now ships with the 9.4 Postgres driver.
fields.summary: The documentation lists invalid driver version numbers for Postgres

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If JIRA is temporarily unable to reach the SQL server (either because of a network problem, or SQL maintenance that leaves SQL unresponsive), scheduled tasks like email processing (inbound and outbound) can become broken until JIRA is restarted.
Worsening the problem is that JIRA does not provide an indication in the UI that this scenario has happened.   So an outage of SQL can be expected to cause problems in JIRA, but when the SQL server/network has recovered, if JIRA has not been restarted since that time, the JIRA admin might have to wait an extended period of time before realizing this component is not working JIRA.



h3. Suggested Solution
It would be helpful if there was a healthcheck that could detect when SQL has become unavailable for a certain period of time to help alert JIRA Administrators as to when this kind of problem exists on the system.



h3. Why this is important
Customers expect JIRA to be reliable, and when SQL is down, JIRA needs to indicate that in some clear way to the JIRA Admin so they can promptly take action to address the problem.


h3. Workaround 
- Restart JIRA, but obviously this should not be necessary
fields.summary: JIRA healthcheck should notify admin when SQL has been unavailable

fields.description:
*Problem*

All reports in JIRA uses DefaultReaderCache so field values far all issues are cached between executions.

DefaultReaderCache is creating single ArrayList with SingletonLists as values for each field used in reports. On JIRA with 1M issues this will create 2M objects for each field used in reports. As a result on large instances we have hundreds of millions of objects that pollutes jvm memory. On very large instances those objects are humongous so they will cause more troubles.

 

*Solution*

Create JiraDocValues which will store all values for all issues for custom field in single array. 

This way we will be creating one humongous object for a field and avoid unnecessary pressure on memory and GC.

This should not have impact on performance and bring more stability to busy instances.
fields.summary: On large instances reports utilise memory inefficiently

fields.description:
We are developers of the [Attachment Checker for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.akelesconsulting.jira.plugins.AttachmentChecker/server/overview] app.
Our app is checking whether there is any duplicate attachments with the same name or the file limit count is exceeded.

We have discovered when a attachment is uploaded in a Create issue or JSD comment form, a record is inserted for the new temporary attachment.

However, when the form is cancelled, the records in the database are not cleared.
Over time, the database will contain a lot of records of the attachments which have not been uploaded.

h3.  Example 
{code}
select * from tempattachmentsmonitor limit 1;
| TEMPORARY_ATTACHMENT_ID | FORM_TOKEN | FILE_NAME    | CONTENT_TYPE | FILE_SIZE | CREATED_TIME  |
+-------------------------+------------+--------------+--------------+-----------+---------------+
| temp1386875119513987260 | undefined  | download.jpg | image/jpeg   |      6772 | 1504691840543 |
+-------------------------+------------+--------------+--------------+-----------+---------------+
 {code}

We will like to suggest to add 2 more fields into the table so that we can identify the attachments attached to the current issue form more accurately.
* creator
* issueid

It will be good to add a scheduled job to housekeep those records which have been created more than 1 day.
fields.summary: To improve in the handling of Temporary attachments records

This does not work with Postgres 10. JIRA throws dozens of stacktraces on startup:
{code:java}
JIRA-Bootstrap INFO [c.a.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger] JIRA pre-database startup checks completed successfully.
JIRA-Bootstrap INFO [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Database Product Name is PostgreSQL
JIRA-Bootstrap INFO [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Database Product Version is 10beta3
JIRA-Bootstrap INFO [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Database Driver Name is PostgreSQL Native Driver
JIRA-Bootstrap INFO [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Database Driver Version is PostgreSQL 9.1 JDBC4 (build 903)
JIRA-Bootstrap WARN [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Entity "Action" has no table in the database
JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Could not create table "public.jiraaction"
JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE TABLE public.jiraaction (ID NUMERIC(18,0) NOT NULL, issueid NUMERIC(18,0), AUTHOR VARCHAR(255), actiontype VARCHAR(255), actionlevel VARCHAR(255), rolelevel NUMERIC(18,0), actionbody TEXT, CREATED TIMESTAMPTZ, UPDATEAUTHOR VARCHAR(255), UPDATED TIMESTAMPTZ, actionnum NUMERIC(18,0), CONSTRAINT PK_jiraaction PRIMARY KEY (ID))
Error was: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: relation "jiraaction" already exists
JIRA-Bootstrap WARN [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Entity "Application" has no table in the database
JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Could not create table "public.cwd_application"
JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE TABLE public.cwd_application (ID NUMERIC(18,0) NOT NULL, application_name VARCHAR(255), lower_application_name VARCHAR(255), created_date TIMESTAMPTZ, updated_date TIMESTAMPTZ, active NUMERIC(9,0), description VARCHAR(255), application_type VARCHAR(255), credential VARCHAR(255), CONSTRAINT PK_cwd_application PRIMARY KEY (ID))
Error was: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: relation "cwd_application" already exists

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently collecting support zip on Data Center is a painful process. To collect support zip from nodes, an admin has to;
* login to front end node (using server's hostname) 
* go to Administration | Support tool | Support zip
* ssh to the backend server
* copy the support zip to local machine
* *repeat the process for each node*
* attach support zip to Atlassian support

h3. Suggested Solution

Ideally, support zip should be submitted via the UI directly to Atlasian via Support Tool plugin. Otherwise there should be a semi automatic way to collect all support zip to shared-home/log directory.
fields.summary: As Data Center admin, I want an automated way to collect support zip from each node

JIRA 7.3.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Pick a user that isn't you and make a note of their username

You will see your own avatar appear in the upper right corner of the application

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA requires user to exist in the user directory before they can log in using SAML SSO.  
{quote}
If users and groups in your Atlassian application are configured using User Directories, you'll usually want to use the same LDAP directory to be the source of users for both your IdP and Atlassian application. Users need to exist in the user directory before they can log in using SSO.
{quote}  
See for details: [Saml SSO for Atlassian DataCenter|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/saml-single-sign-on-for-atlassian-data-center-applications-857050705.html]

h3. Suggested Solution
* User synchronisation / provisioning from remote directory upon login
* Default groups assignment on user login
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator I want users to be synchronized from remote directory during SAML login

h5. Summary

Currently when an add-on is about to expire, JIRA does not trigger any notification to the JIRA Admin until this has occurred.

This could lead to an interruption in work done if the plugin that expired is one that is important to the daily operation of the company.

h5. Feature Request

Can a functionality be added to JIRA so it sends a notification to the JIRA Admin in the following timeframes:
# A month before the plugin expires.
# 2 Weeks before the plugin expires.
# Add a banner to the JIRA instance letting them know how many days left before the plugin expires once the duration is less than a week?

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This is an edge case of JRASERVER-38147 and JRASERVER-44236.
Thanks to the fix for JRASERVER-44236, the performance problem seemed to be solved in case that the filter permission was global.
However, this problem could still happen in case that the filter permission was *not global* (e.g. the filter was limited to a specific project) and tons of users were associated with the project.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Server 7.4.3
* MySQL (any database is possible)
* OpenLDAP (any directory service is possible)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Prepare a fresh installed JIRA 7.4.3 + MySQL
# Integrate JIRA with any external directory and synchronize users and groups
#- In the external directory,
*-- there are some users like 'testuser1', 'testuser2'...
*-- there is one group 'testgroup' and the above users belong to the group
#- Please make sure that JIRA internal directory is on top of the order
# Make sure that the user who is reproducing this bug has *Browse Users* global permission
# Create a project on JIRA
# Go to _Project management > Permission_ and give *Browse project* permission to 'testgroup'
#* In case *Any logged in user* has the permission, please revoke the permission and assigned it to the user who is reproducing this bug as well
# Create some filters and share them with the project which you created in the step 4
# Register the filters as your favorite ones
# Open Issue Navigator

h3. Expected Results

No performance problem happens.

h3. Actual Results

The following SQL were executed once for each favorite filter (like {{/rest/api/2/filter/10001}}) and *as many times as the number of the favorite filters* for {{rest/api/2/filter/favorite}} and they could consume the DB resources and JVM heap memory (cause Full GC, see another ticket for details: JRASERVER-65930)

{code:sql}
2017-09-04 07:52:35,407 http-nio-55049-exec-5 admin 472x898x1 1l1x7vx /rest/api/2/filter/10001 0ms "SELECT user_name FROM cwd_user WHERE (lower_user_name IN ('testuser1', 'testuser2') ) AND (directory_id =  '1' ) ORDER BY lower_user_name"
{code}

Moreover, all the users in the group appeared in the *WHERE* condition {{lower_user_name IN ('testuser1', 'testuser2')}}. The SQL seemed to check if the users who belong to the group are not in the higher ordered directory.

In conclusion, the more users in the external directory are associated with the project, the more DB resources are consumed. It doesn't seem to be scalable. Let's think about the following scenario.

# There are many filters which are limited to specific projects
# Tons of users are associated with the each project
# Some users register many of such filters as their favorite ones
# The users access Issue Navigator at the same time
 
h3. Notes
* There seemed to be some difference in the SQL between JIRA 7.4.x and JIRA 7.3.x.
** JIRA 7.4.x
{code:sql}
2017-09-04 07:52:35,407 http-nio-55049-exec-5 admin 472x898x1 1l1x7vx /rest/api/2/filter/10001 0ms "SELECT user_name FROM cwd_user WHERE (lower_user_name IN ('testuser1', 'testuser2') ) AND (directory_id =  '1' ) ORDER BY lower_user_name"
{code}
** JIRA 7.3.x
{code}
2017-09-04 07:24:08,162 http-nio-41186-exec-4 admin 444x1796x1 1luqcea /rest/api/2/filter/10003 0ms "SELECT user_name FROM cwd_user WHERE ((lower_user_name =  'testuser1' ) OR (lower_user_name =  'testuser2' )) AND (directory_id =  '1' ) ORDER BY lower_user_name"
{code}
* Please refer to [my internal comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-65892?focusedCommentId=1603467&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1603467] for the additional information

h3.Workaround
* Reduce number of favourite filters
* Dark feature {{com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.UserListResolver.getShareCount.disabled}} flag could solve the performance problem
*- Only available with Jira 7.0.0+
*- (!) API break. There is a risk that {{/rest/api/2/filter/favourite}} API doesn't return a correct number of the share count
* Change the directory order
*- This problem could still happen in case that there are tons of users in JIRA internal directory who were associated with the project

h3. Note on fix 
* The issue was work-arounded in 7.2.12, 7.6.1 and 7.7 by introducing an extra query param _enableSharedUsers_ to {{/rest/api/2/filter/favourite}} and {{/rest/api/2/filter/id}} to show that users shouldn't be calculated.
** By default, this param is true, so endpoints are fully backwards compatible. So that still can cause the mentioned problem 
** We've started using this param in JIRA itself ( issue-nav uses _enableSharedUsers=false_), so the problem should be fixed for JIRA.
fields.summary: Favourite filters REST Resource is needlessly retrieving associated share users

fields.description:
h3. Problem:

In JIRA Data Center, it is possible that a node is not able to startup due to other node is holding a cluster lock.
h3. Symptom:

JIRA is not able to startup, the log records it stucks getting current.getstatus()
{code:java}
2017-09-03 19:50:07,583 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 DEBUG      [o.objectweb.jotm.jta] Current.getStatus()
2017-09-03 19:50:07,584 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 DEBUG      [o.objectweb.jotm.jta] Current.getStatus()
2017-09-03 19:50:07,585 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 DEBUG      [o.objectweb.jotm.jta] Current.getStatus()
2017-09-03 19:50:07,585 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 DEBUG      [o.objectweb.jotm.jta] Current.getStatus()
2017-09-03 19:50:07,586 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 DEBUG      [o.objectweb.jotm.jta] Current.getStatus()
2017-09-03 19:50:07,587 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 DEBUG      [o.objectweb.jotm.jta] Current.getStatus()
2017-09-03 19:50:10,095 localhost-startStop-1 DEBUG      [o.objectweb.jotm.jta] Current.getStatus()
2017-09-03 19:50:10,097 localhost-startStop-1 DEBUG      [o.objectweb.jotm.jta] Current.getStatus()
2017-09-03 19:50:10,581 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 DEBUG      [o.objectweb.jotm.jta] Current.getStatus()
2017-09-03 19:50:10,583 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 DEBUG      [o.objectweb.jotm.jta] Current.getStatus() 
{code}
From the CLUSTERLOCKSTATUS, we can see one of the nodes holding the clusterlock
 !clusterlock.png|thumbnail!

node-2 is not able to startup with the following found in the thread dump of node-2
{noformat}
"localhost-startStop-1" #36 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f732c002000 nid=0x666f waiting on condition [0x00007f73454e1000]

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no way to kill a user session if a user is found to be calling requests which could slow down the overall performance of JIRA application.

None
